content: nina nicholson for spoonsandhooks com tip lay yarn end along ring and crochet round 1 over it for an effortless weave-in round 2 chain 3 and turn 2 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet in chain 2 space to form a corner chain 1 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet in 3 remaining chain 2 spaces chain 1 and slip_stitch in top of starting chain 3 round 3 chain 3 and turn 2 double_crochet in chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet in each chain 2 space in corner and chain 1 3 double_crochet in each chain 1 space on side chain 1 and slip_stitch in top of starting chain 3 repeat round 3 until square reaches desired size final round binding chain 1 and turn single_crochet in each double_crochet and through each chain 1 space on sides in corners work 4 single_crochet through chain 2 space slip_stitch in starting chain 1 cut 6 tail and fasten_off page 3 of 6 crochet pattern granny square cocoon cardigan © 2017 nina nicholson for spoonsandhooks com step 2 stitch together sides forming armholes fold square in half with right sides together to form a rectangle taking care to align 3 double_crochet clusters and chain 1 spaces to the clusters and spaces on the opposite side note if you made your granny square using the above instructions in which you turn the work after every round both sides will probably look pretty much the same and you can pick whichever side you like best to be the right side beginning 7 from fold single_crochet through all loops of binding final round single_crochet note beginning 7 from fold creates a 14 armhole which will fit most if necessary the armhole size can be adjusted smaller or larger by starting the side seam closer to or farther from the fold page 4 of 6 crochet pattern granny square cocoon cardigan © 2017 nina nicholson for spoonsandhooks com continue working single_crochet all along side at the corner work single_crochet through first 2 st of corner only cut 6 end and fasten_off repeat on other side step 3 add borders to the front opening and both armholes round 1 join yarn with slip_stitch in single_crochet binding near one of the side seams made in step 2 chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet of binding until you reach chain 1 slip_stitch in chain 1 tip crochet round 1 over yarn ends left from binding and side seams for effortless weave-ins page 5 of 6 crochet pattern granny square cocoon cardigan © 2017 nina nicholson for spoonsandhooks com rounds 2-6 chain 1 and turn single_crochet around until you reach chain 1 slip_stitch in chain 1 rounds 2-5 use the invisible finish round 6 weave in ends if you crocheted over all previous yarn ends and used the russian join to add new skeins of yarn you should only have three ends left to weave in one for the front border and one for each sleeve page
